content: You can’t talk about Outsiders without at least giving a nod to the wonderful work Dave McClure has done with 500 startups. I was traveling the world with him through GeeksonaPlane as far back as 2009 to China, Singapore, Korea, Argentina, Brazil, Chile, Turkey, Israel, Jordan and Dubai — he invested in those places, and he’s now in Africa as I write this. I remember when people thought his philosophy was crazy, but I’ve seen all those entrepreneurial hubs outside the US, never mind just Silicon Valley, and I believe Y Combinator doesn’t deserve all the glowing praise you gave it in your story, since it is late to the game. Yes, I’m biased. When you’ve watched McClure roam the globe almost alone for the better part of a decade, being dismissed as crazy by the guys in the checked shirts with the gray hair because he’s in a tshirt and flipflops, you are bound to be biased:-)
